Sunglasses with a built-in camera: This would allow the wearer to take photos or record videos without having to hold a separate camera. The sunglasses could have a small, high-quality camera built into the frame.
Sunglasses with a built-in GPS: This would allow the wearer to navigate while wearing sunglasses. The GPS could be connected to the sunglasses via Bluetooth and provide turn-by-turn directions.
Sunglasses with a built-in flashlight: This would allow the wearer to see in low-light conditions. The flashlight could be built into the frame of the sunglasses.
Sunglasses with a built-in speaker: This would allow the wearer to listen to music or take phone calls without having to use headphones. The speaker could be built into the frame of the sunglasses.

Sunglasses with a built-in microphone: This would allow the wearer to make phone calls or use voice commands without having to hold a separate device. The microphone could be built into the frame of the sunglasses.
